top_procedures.description: Ultrasound evaluation of blood vessel during diagnosis or treatment, initial vessel
Insertion of needle and/or catheter into dialysis circuit and balloon dilation of dialysis segment, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation

Excision of blood clot and/or infusion to dissolve blood clot in dialysis circuit and balloon dilation of dialysis segment, , accessed through the skin, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation, with balloon catheter
Removal or dissolving of blood clot in dialysis circuit, with balloon dilation of dialysis segment and placement of stent, accessed through skin, with imaging
Dialysis services (4 or more physician visits per month), patient 20 years of age and older
Balloon dilation of dialysis segment, accessed through the skin, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Insertion of needle and/or tube into hemodialysis circuit and insertion of stent in dialysis segment with review by radiologist
Ultrasound evaluation of blood vessel during diagnosis or treatment, each additional vessel
Insertion of catheter into chest or arm artery, each first order branch
Insertion of needle and/or catheter into dialysis circuit, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Balloon dilation of vein with review by radiologist, initial vein
Permanent blockage of dialysis circuit, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Replacement of central venous catheter, tunneled without port or pump
Insertion of central venous catheter for infusion, patient 5 years or older, tunneled
Hemodialysis procedure with one physician evaluation
Radiological supervision and interpretation of imaging of artery of one arm or leg
Ultrasound guidance for accessing into blood vessel
Dialysis services (2-3 physician visits per month), patient 20 years of age and older
Subsequent hospital inpatient care, typically 35 minutes per day
Moderate sedation services by physician also performing a procedure, patient 5 years of age or older, first 15 minutes
